Exaggerate: The claim may be seen as exaggerating the situation by suggesting that convicted murderers or rapists sitting in jail always receive stimulus checks, while hard-working law-abiding citizens earning $80,000 never do.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim may falter at times by not providing a complete and accurate picture of the stimulus check eligibility criteria.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to substantiate the assertion that convicted murderers or rapists sitting in jail always receive stimulus checks.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that all hard-working law-abiding citizens earning $80,000 never receive a stimulus check, which may be a problematic assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations or circumstances that may affect stimulus check eligibility for individuals in jail or prison.
